p: The soil pH in the two soil layers showed a trend of SC > MC > TC, and the pH of the SC community was significantly greater than that of the TC community. The soil water content of the two layers showed a trend of TC > MC > SC, but only in the 15â€“30 cm soil layer was there significant difference. The electrical conductivity (EC), soil organic carbon (SOC), and particulate organic carbon (POC) in the two soil layers all showed the trend of MC > TC > SC, and the differences were significant at a p level of < 0.05 ( Table S1).
